documenttitle.text: Red Hat Bug Fix Advisory: podman bug fix update

note.text: An updated podman package that fixes one bug is now available for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7 Extras.
note.title: Topic

note.text:
The podman tool manages pods, container images, and containers. It is part of the libpod library, which is for applications that use container pods. Container pods is a concept in Kubernetes.

Users of podman are advised to upgrade to this updated package, which fixes one bug.
note.title: Details

note.title: Terms of Use

note.text: The default OCI Linux spec in oci/defaults{_linux}.go in Docker/Moby, from 1.11 to current, does not block /proc/acpi pathnames. The flaw allows an attacker to modify host's hardware like enabling/disabling Bluetooth or turning up/down keyboard brightness.
note.title: Vulnerability Description

description.text:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

reference.Description: bz#1598581: CVE-2018-10892 docker: container breakout without selinux in enforcing mode

acknowledgment.Description: This issue was discovered by Antonio Murdaca (Red Hat).

fullproductname.text: podman-0:0.9.2-5.git37a2afe.el7_5 as a component of Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7 Extras
